official-title.#text:
To require the Comptroller General of the United States to submit to the Congress a report on
			 adoption disruption and dissolution in the United States.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Securing American Families Everywhere (SAFE Kids) Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Comptroller General of the United
			 States

text.#text: Within 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

header.#text: Study on adoption disruption and dissolution

text.#text:
recommends legislation to define adoption disruption and adoption dissolution, to prevent adoption
			 disruption and adoption dissolution, and require State and local
			 governments and child welfare agencies to track and report on disrupted or
			 dissolved adoptions; and

sets forth legislative options to prepare prospective adoptive parents for adoption and to support
			 adoptive parents after an adoption.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5881 IH: Securing American Families Everywhere (SAFE Kids) Act
